lifecycle.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles

items.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles

generate.description: Adds a step that will generate a support bundle. It has no arguments, but should be specified with an empty object `{}`

message.description: `message` can be used to print a message to the end customer

examples: This process will collect a number of files from the host system to help you debug your problem
Thanks for uploading your bundle! SuperGoodTools will get back to you in 24 hours

upload.description: Adds a step in which the end customer can upload a bundle to https://console.replicated.com for review by the vendor

prompt.description: Allows configuring an interactive prompt for the user to confirm before uploading

accept.description: A message to display if the user accepts the upload prompt
examples: Bundle uploaded! SuperGoodTool support will get back to you within 24 hours

decline.description: A message to display if the user declines the upload prompt
examples: Bundle was not uploaded, please send your bundle to SuperGoodTool support

default.description: The default answer to the prompt

specs.description: A list of items to include in the support bundle

items.description: A list of items to include in the support bundle

description.description: A description of the file(s) that will be collected by this spec
examples: The contents of any files in /etc/supergoodtool/conf.d, with secrets redacted

docker.container-cp.description: Collect a file by copying from a running docker container

examples.description: the supergoodtool www site access logs

_ext_outputs.description: Output will match the name of the file. If `src_path` is `/var/log/nginx/access.log`, then `output_dir` will contain a file `access.log`

container.description: The name of the container to copy from

src_path.description: The path of the target file in the container's filesystem

docker.container-exec.description: Collect the stdout and stderr of `exec`-ing a command on a running docker container

_ext_outputs.description: The standard output of the command
The standard error of the command

container.description: The name of the container to run the command in

exec_config.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/configs.go#L43)

AttachStdout.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

User.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

docker.container-inspect.description: Collect the `docker inspect` output for one or more running or stopped containers. One of `container` or `container_list_options` is required.

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output of the inspect call. Will generate this file for each matched container
The json output of the inspect call. Will generate this file for each matched container
The human-readable output of the inspect call. Will generate this file for each matched container

enable_pull.description: If `true`, allow this container to be pulled if not present

docker.service-logs.description: Collect logs from a docker swarm service. One of `service` or `service_list_options` is required.

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output of the logs call. Will generate this file for each matched service

container_logs_options.description: Args as would be given to `docker logs`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/client.go#L73)

Details.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Follow.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStderr.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStdout.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Since.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Tail.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Timestamps.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Until.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

service.description: A single docker swarm service for which to collect logs

service_list_options.description: Options for filtering all swarm services

Filters.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

.*.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

docker.service-ls.description: Collect a list of docker swarm services

examples.description: List of all services starting with `cooltool-`

Filters.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

.*.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

docker.service-ps.description: Collect information about the tasks run by one or more services

examples.description: List of all services starting with `cooltool-`

Filters.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ps`

.*.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ps`

docker.stack-service-logs.description: Collect logs from one or more services in a stack

examples.description: Logs from services in the cooltool stack

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output. Will generate this file for each matched service

container_logs_options.description: Args as would be given to `docker logs`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/client.go#L73)

Details.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Follow.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStderr.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStdout.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Since.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Tail.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Timestamps.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Until.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

service_list_options.description: Options as would be passed to `docker stack services

docker.stack-service-ls.description: Collect information about services in a swarm stack

examples.description: Logs from services in the cooltool stack

service_list_options.description: Options as would be passed to `docker stack services

docker.stack-service-ps.description: Collect information about the tasks running in a service

examples.description: Tasks owned by services in the cooltool stack

task_list_options.description: Options as would be passed to `docker stack ps`

docker.stack-task-logs.description: Collect logs from a docker swarm task

examples.description: Logs from services in the cooltool stack

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output. Will generate this file for each matched service task

container_logs_options.description: Args as would be given to `docker logs`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/client.go#L73)

docker.task-logs.description: Collect logs from a docker swarm task

examples.description: Logs from cooltool tasks in the www and api tiers

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output. Will generate this file for each matched service task

container_logs_options.description: Args as would be given to `docker logs`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/client.go#L73)

id.description: The id of a single task

docker.version.description: Get the version of the docker server

_ext_outputs.description: The raw output the `journald` logs for the unit

reverse.description: Store logs in reverse chronological order

unit.description: Systemd unit from which to collect logs

os.http-request.description: Collect information about the response from making an HTTP request

header.description: One or more headers to send

insecure.description: Set to `true` to skip TLS verification

template.description: (Optional) a template for the human-readable output

os.read-file.description: Read a file from the filesystem

filepath.description: The file path on the host. If running Support Bundle via docker, this will work, but symlinks are not supported

os.run-command.description: Run a command. Will be run in the support bundle container if `docker run replicated/support-bundle` is used. To run in a custom container, use `docker.run` instead

_ext_outputs.description: The standard error of the comand
examples:
Usage: ping [-aAbBdDfhLnOqrRUvV] [-c count] [-i interval] [-I interface]
 [-m mark] [-M pmtudisc_option] [-l preload] [-p pattern] [-Q tos]
 [-s packetsize] [-S sndbuf] [-t ttl] [-T timestamp_option]
 [-w deadline] [-W timeout] [hop1 ...] destination

_ext_outputs.description: The standard output of the comand
examples:
PING google.com (172.217.11.78) 56(84) bytes of data.
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=1 ttl=54 time=203 ms
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=2 ttl=54 time=28.0 ms
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=3 ttl=54 time=130 ms

dir.description: The working directory of the command

os.uptime.description: Collect information about the system's uptime

_ext_outputs.description: The contents of the uptime file

retraced.events.description: Collect Audit Log events from a running Retraced instance

_ext_outputs.description: The audit events in CSV format

api_endpoint.description: The location of the Audit Logs API endpoint in the form `http(s)://<host>:<port>`

api_token.description: An API token for communicating with the audit log instance

insecure.description: Set to `true` to skip SSL verification on the endpoint

mask.description: A mask to determine what fields to include in the output file, as in https://github.com/retracedhq/retraced-go/blob/master/graphql.go#L160

query.description: A structured query for filtering events, as in https://github.com/retracedhq/retraced-go/blob/master/graphql.go#L16
